rows.story_text:
One day Akadeli, Lucy, Acharait, and Mary went to pick wild fruit.

They held hands to cross the big river.

story_text.eng:
One day Akadeli, Lucy, Acharait, and Mary went to pick wild fruit.

They held hands to cross the big river.

annotation_2.eng: Describe the patterns you see in their clothing. Do you like to wear solids, patterns, or both?

annotation_3.eng: Friends sometimes hold hands to keep each other company or show they are friends. Why are these girls holding hands?

rows.annotation_2: Describe the patterns you see in their clothing. Do you like to wear solids, patterns, or both?
rows.annotation_3: Friends sometimes hold hands to keep each other company or show they are friends. Why are these girls holding hands?

rows.story_text:
The girls found a tree full of ripe fruit.

They agreed to pick the fruit with their eyes closed.

story_text.eng:
The girls found a tree full of ripe fruit.

They agreed to pick the fruit with their eyes closed.

annotation_1.eng: Name all the colors in the colorful clothes they are wearing.

annotation_2.eng: Each girl has her arms in a different position. Can you copy their arm positions with your arms?

annotation_3.eng: Count together the branches coming off the main trunk of this tree. You will have to decide which ones are big enough to count.

rows.annotation_1: Name all the colors in the colorful clothes they are wearing.
rows.annotation_2: Each girl has her arms in a different position. Can you copy their arm positions with your arms?
rows.annotation_3: Count together the branches coming off the main trunk of this tree. You will have to decide which ones are big enough to count.

rows.story_text:
Lucy, Acharait and Mary did not close their eyes.

Only Akadeli closed hers.

story_text.eng:
Lucy, Acharait and Mary did not close their eyes.

Only Akadeli closed hers.

annotation_1.eng: Why do you think the other girls did not close their eyes?

annotation_2.eng: This is a good climbing tree. Count together the branches that look the strongest.

annotation_3.eng: Do you ever do things with your eyes closed, just for fun?

rows.annotation_1: Why do you think the other girls did not close their eyes?
rows.annotation_2: This is a good climbing tree. Count together the branches that look the strongest.
rows.annotation_3: Do you ever do things with your eyes closed, just for fun?

rows.story_text: When they opened their eyes, only Akadeli had picked unripe fruit.

story_text.eng: When they opened their eyes, only Akadeli had picked unripe fruit.

annotation_1.eng: Estimate how many pieces of fruit there are in one basket. Estimating means making an informed guess. Is your estimate bigger than the biggest number you know?

annotation_2.eng: What shapes are there on the two blue dresses?

annotation_3.eng: Did you ever play a game where some of the people didn't follow the rules? How did it make you feel?

rows.annotation_1: Estimate how many pieces of fruit there are in one basket. Estimating means making an informed guess. Is your estimate bigger than the biggest number you know?
rows.annotation_2: What shapes are there on the two blue dresses?
rows.annotation_3: Did you ever play a game where some of the people didn't follow the rules? How did it make you feel?

rows.story_text:
Lucy, Acharait, and Mary laughed at Akadeli. They left for home.

Akadeli threw away the unripe fruit. She began picking ripe ones.

story_text.eng:
Lucy, Acharait, and Mary laughed at Akadeli. They left for home.

Akadeli threw away the unripe fruit. She began picking ripe ones.

annotation_1.eng: If you have four girls and you take three away, how many are left?

annotation_2.eng: When people laugh at you, does that make you feel angry or ashamed? Were you able to ignore them knowing they were just being mean

annotation_3.eng: Why did Akadeli stay behind to pick fruit?

rows.annotation_1: If you have four girls and you take three away, how many are left?
rows.annotation_2: When people laugh at you, does that make you feel angry or ashamed? Were you able to ignore them knowing they were just being mean
rows.annotation_3: Why did Akadeli stay behind to pick fruit?

rows.story_text:
Soon, Akadeli filled her basket with ripe fruit.

She set off alone, crossing the big river.

story_text.eng:
Soon, Akadeli filled her basket with ripe fruit.

She set off alone, crossing the big river.

annotation_1.eng: How many splashes can you count when her fruit hits the water?

annotation_3.eng: Why do you think Akadeli slipped in the river when no one slipped before? Is there another reason for holding hands?

rows.annotation_1: How many splashes can you count when her fruit hits the water?
rows.annotation_3: Why do you think Akadeli slipped in the river when no one slipped before? Is there another reason for holding hands?

rows.story_text:
Half way across the river, Akadeli's fruit fell into the water.

She was angry and began to cry.

story_text.eng:
Half way across the river, Akadeli's fruit fell into the water.

She was angry and began to cry.

annotation_1.eng: Akadeli is standing in the middle of some circles in the water. How many?

annotation_2.eng: People cry sometimes when they are sad or angry. Have you been sad or angry when you spilled something?

annotation_3.eng: Count together the dark squares in the checkerboard pattern on her shirt.

rows.annotation_1: Akadeli is standing in the middle of some circles in the water. How many?
rows.annotation_2: People cry sometimes when they are sad or angry. Have you been sad or angry when you spilled something?
rows.annotation_3: Count together the dark squares in the checkerboard pattern on her shirt.

rows.story_text: Akadeli saw a big fish and grabbed it.

story_text.eng: Akadeli saw a big fish and grabbed it.

annotation_1.eng: Is it okay that Akadeli lost her basket? Do you think her parents will be mad?

annotation_2.eng: The title says this is Akadeli's lucky day. How is Akadeli's day going so far?

annotation_3.eng: Is this fish bigger or smaller than Akadeli?

rows.annotation_1: Is it okay that Akadeli lost her basket? Do you think her parents will be mad?
rows.annotation_2: The title says this is Akadeli's lucky day. How is Akadeli's day going so far?
rows.annotation_3: Is this fish bigger or smaller than Akadeli?

rows.story_text:
As Akadeli walked home, a hawk snatched the fish.

He flew away with it.

story_text.eng:
As Akadeli walked home, a hawk snatched the fish.

He flew away with it.

annotation_1.eng: The hawk snatched the fish with the talons on its feet. How many talons do you see?

annotation_2.eng: The hawk's wings and Akadeli's shirt look a bit alike -- describe how they are similar and how they are different.

annotation_3.eng: What is Akadeli feeling as she watches the hawk fly away with her fish?

rows.annotation_1: The hawk snatched the fish with the talons on its feet. How many talons do you see?
rows.annotation_2: The hawk's wings and Akadeli's shirt look a bit alike -- describe how they are similar and how they are different.
rows.annotation_3: What is Akadeli feeling as she watches the hawk fly away with her fish?

rows.story_text:
The hawk left behind a feather from its tail.

Akadeli picked up the feather and continued walking home.

story_text.eng:
The hawk left behind a feather from its tail.

Akadeli picked up the feather and continued walking home.

annotation_1.eng: How many spots are on this feather?

annotation_2.eng: Have you ever found a feather? Was it very colorful?

annotation_3.eng: There are three kinds of plants in this picture. Point at the tallest and shortest ones.

rows.annotation_1: How many spots are on this feather?
rows.annotation_2: Have you ever found a feather? Was it very colorful?
rows.annotation_3: There are three kinds of plants in this picture. Point at the tallest and shortest ones.

rows.story_text:
She came across a traditional wedding. Dancers were wearing grass on their heads instead of feathers as was the tradition.

They took her feather and gave her a big bull!

story_text.eng:
She came across a traditional wedding. Dancers were wearing grass on their heads instead of feathers as was the tradition.

They took her feather and gave her a big bull!

annotation_1.eng: Count how many people are wearing yellow grass on their heads.

annotation_2.eng: Estimate how many people it would take to weigh as much as that bull.

annotation_3.eng: Surprisingly, Akadeli traded a feather for a bull. Why did the people do that?

rows.annotation_1: Count how many people are wearing yellow grass on their heads.
rows.annotation_2: Estimate how many people it would take to weigh as much as that bull.
rows.annotation_3: Surprisingly, Akadeli traded a feather for a bull. Why did the people do that?

rows.story_text:
Akadeli reached home with her bull. Her parents and relatives were so happy. Lucy, Acharait, and Mary wished they had not lied to Akadeli.

It was a lucky day for Akadeli!

story_text.eng:
Akadeli reached home with her bull. Her parents and relatives were so happy. Lucy, Acharait, and Mary wished they had not lied to Akadeli.

It was a lucky day for Akadeli!

annotation_1.eng: How do you think the other girls feel?

annotation_2.eng: Have you ever lied to someone? If so, did it make you feel sorry or ashamed?

annotation_3.eng: Count the number of difficult moments in Akadeli's day. All turned out well in the end. Life can be full of surprises!

rows.annotation_1: How do you think the other girls feel?
rows.annotation_2: Have you ever lied to someone? If so, did it make you feel sorry or ashamed?
rows.annotation_3: Count the number of difficult moments in Akadeli's day. All turned out well in the end. Life can be full of surprises!
